thread.title: Albany Devils lose preseason finale
thread.title_full: Albany Devils lose preseason finale - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Albany Devils lose preseason finale
text:
The Albany Devils suffered a 2-1 loss in overtime to the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins in Albany's final exhibition game of the preseason on Friday evening in Wilkes-Barre, Pa.
Kael Mouillierat scored the game-winning goal with 25 seconds remaining in overtime.
Albany opens the 2015-16 regular season on the road at 7:05 p.m. on Saturday, Oct. 10, against the Binghamton Senators.
Wilkes-Barre took a 1-0 lead in the second period when Conor Sheary scored with 7:50 left.
Devils rookie Joseph Blandisi leveled the game at 1 with an unassisted goal at 8:26 of the third period.
Blandisi finished with three points in two preseason games. He finished with 112 points, including a league-best 52 goals, with Barrie of the Ontario Hockey League in the 2014-15 season.
Scott Wedgewood suffered the loss and made 33 stops. He denied a penalty shot by Anton Zlobin in the second period. Tristan Jarry earned the win and made 19 stops.
Albany killed off all six penalties and finished the preseason a perfect 10-for-10 in that category.
